Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: The major input data is NASA Team algorithm-derived SMMR-SSM/I-SSMIS sea ice concentration data over Antarctic Region (Cavalieri, 1996) for 36 years (October 1978 to December 2014). The data was downloaded from NSIDC data site: (http://nsidc.org/data(link is external)).

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Following are the three major processing steps :

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: i. Classification of pixels into sea-ice and non-sea-ice classes.

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: ii. Determination of sea-ice-pixel frequency over study period

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: iii. Calculation of Sea Ice Probability

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: iv. Converting the data into three (.bin, .tif, and .png) formats.

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: This dataset may be cited as (Rajak et al, 2015). Rajak D. Ram, R.K. Kamaljit Singh, Jayaprasad P., Sandip R. Oza, Rashmi Sharma, and Raj Kumar (2015). Sea Ice Occurrence Probability Data and Its Applications Over the Antarctic. Manuscript submitted to a journal.

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: This dataset may be cited as (Rajak et al, 2015).

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Comiso, J. C. 2000, updated 2014. Bootstrap Sea Ice Concentrations from Nimbus-7 SMMR and DMSP SSM/I-SSMIS. Version 2. [October 1978 to December 2012]. Boulder, Colorado USA: NASA DAAC at the National Snow and Ice Data Center.

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Rajak D. Ram, R.K. Kamaljit Singh, Jayaprasad P., Sandip R. Oza, Rashmi Sharma, and Raj Kumar (2015). PROBABILISTIC SEA ICE OCCURRENCE DATA OVER ANTARCTIC REGION. Manuscript under preparation.

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Daily Probability of occurrence of sea ice: Pr = 100 x N / (Y-n)

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: N, is the number of times the pixel has been classified as sea ice (sea ice concentration => 15%);

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Y, is the total possible observations, and

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: n is the number of years with data loss on that particular date.

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Accuracy assessment of the dataset has not been carried out.

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: The inherent problems of the major input sea ice concentration data (from NSIDC site) may be considered the problems with this dataset.

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Northern Hemisphere EASE-Grid 2.0 Weekly Snow Cover and Sea Ice Extent. Version 4. Boulder, Colorado USA: NASA DAAC at the National Snow and Ice Data Center (Brodzik, M. and R. Armstrong. 2013.). [http://nsidc.org/data(link is external)].

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: The file names follows SIOP36_MMDD_S.bin[.tif/.png] naming convention;

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: MM refers to month number (01 to 12, 01 being January),

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: DD refers to date of the month, and

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Data types are indicated by .bin (binary), .tif (geotiff), and .png (portable network graphics).

Page Title: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
